title: Much / Many / A Lot Of
description: Слушайте и определяйте количество: much, many или a lot of.

tasks.audioText: I went to the supermarket today. I spent a lot of money there.
tasks.transcript: I spent a lot of money there.

options.text: The person spent very little money.
The person spent a large amount of money.
The person did not buy anything.
The supermarket was closed.

tasks.explanation: 'A lot of money' means a large amount.

tasks.audioText: We only have a little time. We don't have much time before the train.
tasks.transcript: We don't have much time before the train.

options.text: They have plenty of time.
The train is cancelled.
They are running short on time.
They missed the train.

tasks.explanation: 'Don't have much time' means very little time is left.

tasks.audioText: I looked at the guest list. How many people are coming to the wedding?
tasks.transcript: How many people are coming to the wedding?

options.text: The person asks about the number of guests.
The person asks when the wedding is.
The person asks where the wedding is.
The person says nobody is coming.

tasks.explanation: 'How many' asks about the number of countable things — people.

tasks.audioText: I went to the park on Saturday. There were a lot of children playing there.
tasks.transcript: There were a lot of children playing there.

options.text: The park was empty on Saturday.
Many children were playing in the park.
Only one child was at the park.
The park was closed on Saturday.

tasks.explanation: 'A lot of children' means many kids were there.

tasks.audioText: Be careful with this recipe. Don't add too much salt to the soup.
tasks.transcript: Don't add too much salt to the soup.

options.text: You should add a lot of salt.
The soup needs more salt.
You should use only a small amount of salt.
The soup has no salt at all.

tasks.explanation: 'Too much salt' is a warning — keep the amount small.

tasks.audioText: My daughter reads every day. She has many books in her room.
tasks.transcript: She has many books in her room.

options.text: She has a large number of books.
She has only one book.
She does not like reading.
Her room has no books.

tasks.explanation: 'Many books' means a large number of books.

tasks.audioText: I am making tea for everyone. How much milk do you want in your tea?
tasks.transcript: How much milk do you want in your tea?

options.text: The person asks about the amount of milk.
The person asks how many cups of tea.
The person says there is no milk.
The person is making coffee.

tasks.explanation: 'How much' asks about the amount of uncountable things — milk.

tasks.audioText: The city centre is always busy. There are a lot of cars on the road.
tasks.transcript: There are a lot of cars on the road.

options.text: The road is empty.
There are very few cars.
The road has heavy traffic.
The road is closed.

tasks.explanation: 'A lot of cars' means the road is very busy with traffic.

tasks.audioText: I need to drink more. I didn't drink much water today.
tasks.transcript: I didn't drink much water today.

options.text: The person drank a lot of water.
The person drank only a little water.
The person drank too much water.
The person drank juice instead.

tasks.explanation: 'Didn't drink much' means the amount was small.

tasks.audioText: We invited our friends for dinner. There were many guests at our table.
tasks.transcript: There were many guests at our table.

options.text: Nobody came to dinner.
Only two people came.
A large number of friends came for dinner.
The dinner was cancelled.

tasks.explanation: 'Many guests' means a large number of people were there.

tasks.audioText: It is hot outside today. We need a lot of water for the hike.
tasks.transcript: We need a lot of water for the hike.

options.text: They need a large amount of water.
They do not need water.
They have enough water already.
It is cold outside.

tasks.explanation: 'A lot of water' means they need a large quantity.

tasks.audioText: This course is popular. How many students are in your class?
tasks.transcript: How many students are in your class?

options.text: The person asks which class it is.
The person asks about the number of students.
The person asks who the teacher is.
The person asks where the class is.

tasks.explanation: 'How many students' asks about the number of people in the class.

tasks.audioText: I am worried about the exam. I don't have much time to study.
tasks.transcript: I don't have much time to study.

options.text: The person has plenty of time.
The person has very little time for studying.
The exam is easy.
The person does not want to study.

tasks.explanation: 'Don't have much time' means the time available is very short.

tasks.audioText: My grandmother loves gardening. She grows many flowers in her garden.
tasks.transcript: She grows many flowers in her garden.

options.text: She has no flowers.
She has a large number of flowers.
She grows only vegetables.
She does not have a garden.

tasks.explanation: 'Many flowers' means a large number of flowers grow there.

tasks.audioText: I work at a restaurant every day. We get a lot of customers at lunchtime.
tasks.transcript: We get a lot of customers at lunchtime.

options.text: Very few people come for lunch.
The restaurant is always empty.
Many people come to eat lunch there.
The restaurant is closed at lunch.

tasks.explanation: 'A lot of customers' means many people visit at that time.

short_description: Much / Many / A Lot Of: количество исчисляемых и неисчисляемых
